com.pump.xray

Class SourceCodeManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.xray.SourceCodeManager

  • public class SourceCodeManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This manages a catalog of classes. If you call addClasses(Class...) with exactly one Class object and then call build(), this will reach around and identify all the dependencies required to fully represent the class in question. (And the dependencies of those dependencies, and so on.) For example: you can't represent all the public method signatures of a java.util.HashMap without a java.util.Map, a java.util.Iterator, a java.util.Map$Entry, etc.

    By passing a SourceCodeManager to all StreamWriter subclasses: we give them a callback to constantly declare a need for more classes as they write data.

    • Field Detail

      • classMap

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class>> classMap
        A map of every class to the classes it contains. This is effectively a tree structure compressed into a map, where the parent is the key and the children are the values.

      • populateInnerClasses

        protected void populateInnerClasses(ClassWriter writer,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class>> allClasses)
        Given a parent class's ClassWriter this populates all the necessary inner classes (if any).
        Parameters:
        writer - the parent ClassWriter to possibly add declared/nested classes to.
        allClasses - a map of all classes, where the key is the parent and the value is a collection of its children.

      • getClassMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class>> getClassMap()
        Return a map of every class to the classes it contains. This is effectively a tree structure compressed into a map, where the parent is the key and the children are the values.

        Catalog a Class as being required to emulate/represent in the x-ray'd jar.

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported(java.lang.Class t)
        Return true if the argument should be supported/represented in the x-ray'd jar.

        Subclasses may override this to impose their own rules about what is and isn't appropriate to inlude.

        Parameters:
        t - the class to evaluate.
        Returns:
        true if the argument should be included in the x-ray'd jar.

      • write

        public void write(java.io.File destDir,
                  java.util.Collection<ClassWriter> writers)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writer a series of ClassWriters to a destination directory.
        Parameters:
        destDir - the directory to write to.
        writers - the ClassWriters to write into this directory.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
